results.title: Screen Worlds opening : September 2009
results.brief_description:
On Thursday September 17, 2009 ACMI’s new permanent screen culture exhibition Screen Worlds, was officially launched. The red carpet, VIP event attracted world wide attention with the attendance of both internationally recognised and home grown guests and artists. Kicking off the formalities was ACMI’s Board President, John Thwaites, followed by ACMI Director Tony Sweeney, Oscar® Winning Actress Cate Blanchett, Victorian Arts Minister Lynne Kosky and Victorian Premier John Brumby.
Following this, the ribbon is cut and guests enter the exhibition for the first time.

results.title: An Interview with Peter Isaacson : pathfinder
results.creator_credit: Peter Isaacson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Peter Isaacson tells his story of joining the Air Force in World War II and becoming part of the legendary Pathfinders. Peter also became famous for flying under the Sydney Harbour Bridge towards the end of World War II.
results.description: Peter Isaacson tells his story of joining the Air Force in World War II and becoming part of the legendary Pathfinders. Peter also became famous for flying under the Sydney Harbour Bridge towards the end of World War II.

results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the work and preparation that went into Australia II winning entry in the America’s Cup. Shows the crew at leisure as well as at work.

results.title: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, David Adams, Nick Bosustow and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Visualizes the spectral spirits and twilight superstitions that haunted the drowsy Dutch settlement of Sleepy Hollow. Concerns the rivalry between Ichabod Crane and Brom Bones for the hand of Katrina Van Tassel, and how the Headless Horseman of Sleepy Hollow removes Ichabod from the scene. Screenplay by Joseph Cavella, based on the story by Washington Irving. Narrated by John Carradine.

results.title: The Queen Mother at Essendon Airport
results.brief_description:
Silent footage of the arrival on 27 February 1958 of the Queen Mother at Essendon Airport to a welcoming crowd of waving spectators, military parades and marching bands, and government officials and dignitaries. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Mallacoota fishing trip
results.brief_description:
Mallacoota - There is boatloads of nostalgic charm in this short black and white 1950s film of men taking a fishing trip at Mallacoota. Photographer Athol Adams has captured a sense of fun in this footage, made more entertaining to modern eyes because of the formal clothes the fishermen are wearing. A wonderful glimpse of a different generation at play.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Roamin holiday
results.brief_description: Shot on a random bag of film stock and featuring footage of Inverloch, Marysville and Albury, this holiday footage is one of Frank Straford’s favourite ‘Highway rambles’. The title is a sly reference to the Hollywood film popular at the time.
